meanings.definition: To make more complex or refined
meanings.sent1: She enjoys sophisticating her drawings with intricate details.
meanings.sent2: The chef is sophisticating the recipe by adding exotic spices.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried sophisticating its meow to sound like a lion.
meanings.sent4: His speech was like a beautifully sophisticating painting, full of layers and depth.
meanings.sent5: The garden was sophisticating into a mesmerizing display of colors and scents.

meanings.sent1: The con artist was sophisticating people with his smooth talk.
meanings.sent2: She was caught sophisticating customers with fake products.
meanings.sent3: The magician's rabbit tried sophisticating the audience by pretending to disappear.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a sophisticating mask hiding her true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The email scam was sophisticating many unsuspecting individuals.

meanings.definition: To become more worldly or experienced
meanings.sent1: Traveling to different countries is a great way to start sophisticating yourself.
meanings.sent2: As she grew older, she felt herself sophisticating in her understanding of the world.
meanings.sent3: The young explorer was sophisticating into a seasoned adventurer.
meanings.sent4: Life's challenges were sophisticating her into a wise individual.
meanings.sent5: Each book she read was a step in sophisticating her knowledge and perspective.
